title: 110_hr2689
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as education and support to their immediate family members. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide education, support, counseling, and mental health services to assist veterans in readjusting to civilian life, recovering from injuries or illnesses incurred during deployment, and helping their families readjust upon their return. The program will involve contracts with community mental health centers and other qualified entities in areas not adequately served by VA health care facilities. The Department of Veterans Affairs requires contracting community health centers to employ veterans, use telehealth services, participate in training programs, comply with VA protocols, and submit annual reports to the Secretary. The Department of Veterans Affairs requires community health centers to provide services to veterans, submit annual reports with demographic information, clinical summaries, and meet Secretary's requirements. Veterans are also trained for peer-outreach and peer-support services. The Secretary contracts with a national mental health organization to train veterans for peer-support services. Additionally, clinicians at community mental health centers are trained to provide services tailored to veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary will submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation of a program for veterans' mental health services, including initial plans and status updates. The Secretary will submit reports on the implementation of a program for veterans' mental health services, detailing the number of veterans served and types of services provided. Additionally, an evaluation of services will be conducted with a recommendation on extending the service period. Authorization of appropriations is granted to the Secretary of Veterans Affairs for this purpose. Extension of eligibility for health care services from the Department of Veterans Affairs for veterans of service in combat theater is amended from "2 years" to "5 years" in Section 1710(e)(3)(C) of title 38, United States Code.
